name: Albert Einstein
description: Albert Einstein was a theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics.

name: Marie Curie
description: Marie Curie was a physicist and chemist known for her pioneering research on radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different sciences.

name: Isaac Newton
description: Isaac Newton was an English mathematician, physicist, and astronomer whose laws of motion and gravitation laid the foundation for classical mechanics.

name: Charles Darwin
description: Charles Darwin was a naturalist known for his theory of evolution by natural selection, providing a unifying explanation for the diversity of life on Earth.

name: Nikola Tesla
description: Nikola Tesla was an inventor and electrical engineer known for his contributions to the development of alternating current (AC) electrical systems.

name: Leonardo da Vinci
description: Leonardo da Vinci was a Renaissance polymath celebrated for his contributions to various fields, including science, art, engineering, and anatomy.

name: Galileo Galilei
description: Galileo Galilei was an astronomer and physicist known as the father of observational astronomy and the modern scientific method.

name: Alan Turing
description: Alan Turing was a mathematician and computer scientist known for his work in cryptography and his role in breaking the German Enigma code during World War II.

name: Louis Pasteur
description: Louis Pasteur was a microbiologist and chemist known for his discoveries of the principles of vaccination, microbial fermentation, and pasteurization.

name: Max Planck
description: Max Planck was a physicist recognized for his groundbreaking work in quantum theory, introducing the concept of quantization of energy.

name: Rosalind Franklin
description: Rosalind Franklin was a chemist whose X-ray diffraction images of DNA were critical to the discovery of its double helix structure.

name: Michael Faraday
description: Michael Faraday was a physicist and chemist known for his experiments in electromagnetism, leading to the discovery of electromagnetic induction and diamagnetism.

name: Rachel Carson
description: Rachel Carson was a marine biologist and conservationist whose book 'Silent Spring' catalyzed the environmental movement and led to increased awareness of the dangers of pesticides.

name: Sigmund Freud
description: Sigmund Freud was a neurologist and founder of psychoanalysis, known for his theories on the unconscious mind and the mechanisms of repression.

name: Erwin Schrödinger
description: Erwin Schrödinger was a physicist renowned for his contributions to quantum mechanics, notably the Schrödinger equation and the concept of Schrödinger's cat.

name: Jane Goodall
description: Jane Goodall is a primatologist and conservationist known for her groundbreaking studies of chimpanzees in Tanzania's Gombe Stream National Park.

name: Richard Feynman
description: Richard Feynman was a theoretical physicist known for his work in quantum electrodynamics and his charismatic approach to teaching physics.

name: Carl Sagan
description: Carl Sagan was an astronomer, cosmologist, and science communicator known for popularizing science, particularly through his television series 'Cosmos.'

name: Barbara McClintock
description: Barbara McClintock was a geneticist known for her discovery of mobile genetic elements, or 'jumping genes,' which revolutionized the understanding of genetic regulation.
